message: Ruby or Python for job automation and System administration Tasks. Anyone recommend Go-lang ?

data.message: i think ruby will be great choice with things like Thor gem and other automation DSLs you'll save a lot of time.
Golang is awesome as well but depend what are your automation tasks

Choices in such situation depends on the TASK and DOMAIN . i.e. if you need to do with chef or vagrant , then Ruby basics will be your best choice, as they are just big ruby scripts , and generally at automation scripting language is the best choice ,(edit and run, with no building hassles and dependencies ), if you want to involove with the cutting edge google kubernets , hashicorp  or swarn and docker then It is all golang ,

If you know one language, use it until it the task in hand is blocked because it can only be done in another language or you are going in big workarounds to solve that. If you know both, it doesn't make a difference. If you know one and want to learn the other, that's a different thing.

See examples of automation scripts on github or so using the same tools you want to use, what are most of them written in. If that's a language you know, cool. If not, see if the language you know is used too. If it is, and the experience isn't too bad, go with it, if not, invest in the other language, or choose other way to write the script.
From a ruby side I recommend Ruby, also check Chef for configuration management and systems admin DSL
